cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 560 mi SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest today, turning northwest then north-northwest toward the upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast late Wednesday-Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border, roughly between Port Arthur, TX and Cameron, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, LA; Storm Surge Watch Freeport TX to San Luis Pass TX and mouth of Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Tropical Storm Warning Sargent TX to San Luis Pass TX and east of Intracoastal City LA to mouth of Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coastline, greatest effects north-east of Matagorda Bay
weather_observation.wind: 30% chance of sustained gale-force (≥34 kt) winds late Wed night–Thu; low (5%) chance of ≥50 kt; strongest gusts expected to stay east of port but brief TS-force squalls possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding possible in Matagorda Bay; surge expected to stay below 3–4 ft at the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain possible Thursday with locally higher amounts in bands, producing flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas, dangerous rip currents, and short-period halts to cargo operations likely Wednesday night through Thursday.
